function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Depiction of climate change as a perpetual pandemic may trivialize the severity of actual pandemics and their impact on public health and safety.","Impact":"Undermines the urgency of pandemic response and preparedness efforts, leading to inadequate resource allocation for public health measures.","Mitigation":"Increase public awareness about the distinct nature of climate change and pandemics, and the need for targeted responses to each.","Technologies":"Public health education campaigns, media messaging, and targeted communication strategies.","People":"General public, policymakers, and public health officials.","Owner":"Media outlets, public health organizations, and government agencies."},{"Description":"Failure to prioritize climate policy in the wake of the pandemic may result in missed opportunities to address long-term environmental and societal challenges.","Impact":"Continued dependence on unsustainable practices, contributing to environmental degradation and exacerbating the impacts of climate change.","Mitigation":"Integrate climate considerations into post-pandemic recovery plans and policy decisions, incentivize sustainable practices, and invest in renewable energy infrastructure.","Technologies":"Renewable energy technologies, sustainable development strategies, and green infrastructure.","People":"Policy makers, environmental advocates, and communities at risk from climate change impacts.","Owner":"Government bodies, environmental organizations, and sustainable development initiatives."}]}
